quest.name: A Hard Hapalit to Break
journal: Minfilia has some correspondence she wishes to share with you.

* This quest has been adjusted. Please abandon the quest and restart it by speaking to Minfilia at the Rising Stones.

※The Main Scenario Guide shows the next available quest. You can toggle it on and off in Character Configuration, under UI Settings.

You gather that the inexperienced adventurers who now flock to Revenant's Toll are sorely testing Slafborn's patience. According to him, one young lady in particular would benefit from the guidance of an accomplished veteran like you. Make your way to the Singing Shards, and rescue the would-be hapalit slayer from her intended target.
You have slain the scabrous hapalit. Offer your aid to the struggling adventurer.
You have rescued the adventurer from almost certain death, but the young lady appears intent on blaming others for her own failings. Show her what you think of her attitude with a resounding /huh.
Devastated by your disappointment, the green adventurer swears to do better before slinking off in the direction of town. Return to Revenant's Toll and report to Slafborn.

You return to the bustling settlement to find an appreciative Slafborn. He has witnessed the result of your chastisement, and claims─somewhat hopefully─that the lesson will soon spread through the ranks to the rest of his young charges. He then speaks of the unavoidable hard work required to become a hero, and praises you as a fine example of what dedication and perseverance can achieve.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Now the matter of Ramuh has, for the present, been put to rest, there is something I would show you, Forename.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: It is a letter of thanks, signed by the leaders of the Eorzean Alliance, acknowledging the Scions' tireless service to the realm.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: It mentions, in particular, the names of all of the defeated primals─Ifrit, Titan, Garuda, Good King Moggle Mog XII, Leviathan, and now Ramuh.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Needless to say, there is only one among our number to have faced them all.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: And though these words of gratitude were addressed to our order as a whole, I feel that they were meant for you above all others.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I, too, must offer my heartfelt thanks for all that you have done. In the course of your duties, you have never once failed to answer my call to arms.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: You are a true hero, Forename, and Eorzea is that much the safer for your presence.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Pray do not misunderstand me─I said “safer,” not “safe.” I know only too well that we can ill afford to lower our guard. The Ascians may be relied upon to sow chaos in this realm until such time as they are forced to stop.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Why, even without their encouragement, you may be assured that man would foment strife on his own. And that is to say nothing of the beast tribes. Unless we learn to live in harmony, the primals, too, will return to plague us again and again and again...

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: And yet...despite all of this, your deeds serve to inspire the people─to give them hope for a better tomorrow. And there is no greater gift.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: That we have the courage to strive for what might otherwise seem an impossible peace, we owe in no small part to the dangers you have faced on our behalf, and the people you have won over to our cause in so doing. Our list of enemies has ever been long, but think of the allies with whom we are now blessed...

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Of the beastmen who wish naught of conflict, and who now call you friend.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Of the sylphs of Little Solace, who wish naught of conflict.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Of Alisaie, who strives to unearth the terrible secrets of the Calamity.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Of the Ala Mhigans and the Domans who stand with us, determined to halt the dread march of the Empire.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: And then there is Cid and the fellowship of NOAH, racing to unlock the mysteries of ancient Allag that we might be spared the horror of another Ultima Weapon.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: And then there are the many unsung individuals who have gathered here in Revenant's Toll─honest men and women who seek to employ their skills for the good of all.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: ...Of course, when speaking of our greatest allies, we must not forget those closest to us, by which I mean our fellow Scions.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Thanks to their many and varied talents, our order is uniquely equipped to combat the far-reaching corruption of the Ascians─and combat it we shall!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: (-???-)Your enthusiasm is truly heartwarming, Antecedent. Given our embarrassing wealth of allies, I trust it will not inconvenience you unduly if I absent myself for a time?

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Alphinaud! I take it the troubles in Ul'dah no longer require your attention?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: There are yet some rumblings of discontent, but the air of simmering violence is largely dissipated. 'Tis to report such that I stand before you now.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: That...and to speak with you concerning the new organization we discussed.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Ah, I have a message for you from Ele─ Ahem. You recall the refugee girl? The one whose parents were missing? They were found unharmed. She wished me to pass on her thanks to you.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Why, Alphinaud! Am I to understand that you made the effort to remember the poor girl's name? I look forward to reading all about her in your report. I do hope you left nothing out!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Forename─you have been away from Revenant's Toll for some time now, I believe. Might I suggest that you put the affairs of the realm to one side for the moment and take this opportunity to reacquaint yourself with the town?

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: ...Which reminds me─Slafborn but recently inquired as to your whereabouts. I believe he has some small matter he wishes to discuss with you. Why not oblige him with a visit?

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: Oho, I see my fine adventurer friend has returned, the dust of the road yet clinging to herhis boots. Do the Scions have no work for you this day, then?

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: Hm? The Antecedent sent you my way, did she? Well, it is naught urgent, but I could certainly do with your help.

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: You see, Revenant's Toll has become something of a favored destination for adventurers. Part of that is due to the town's growing fame, but a goodly number of green heroes-to-be have come here to follow in your footsteps.

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: ...And when I say “green,” I mean “fresh out of the ground, don't know one end of a sword from the other” green. I've done what I can, but what they really need is a good talking to from someone they respect. An adventurer who has done it all. Aye, Forename, that would be you.

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: ...And, naturally, the one lass who would most benefit from your wisdom is nowhere to be seen. She was off to slay hapalits, and was due back some time ago. <sigh> Likely got herself in over her head, as usual.

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: Now that I think on it, this may be the perfect opportunity for you to treat her to a demonstration of your skills. I'd consider it a personal favor if you would head out to the Singing Shards and show that amateur how it's done.

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: You'll find our would-be hapalit slayer out in the Singing Shards. Do me a favor, and show her how a real adventurer fights, would you?

dialogue.name: ADVENTURER01454
dialogue.text: Gods help me! Any one o' the Twelve'll do! No one told me they were that big!

dialogue.name: ADVENTURER01454
dialogue.text: Damn near pissed meself back there! I was hopin' to find meself a little one, but the fates went and threw the meanest bugger in all o' Mor Dhona at me. Typical!

dialogue.name: ADVENTURER01454
dialogue.text: Hold up! You're Forename Surname, ain't ye? The Forename Surname! Seven hells! Yer flippin' famous!

dialogue.name: ADVENTURER01454
dialogue.text: An' yer twice as tough as they said ye were, an' all! Bugger me...I can't believe I'm talkin' to the woman herselfman himself!

dialogue.name: ADVENTURER01454
dialogue.text: Aw, an' now ye've gone an' seen me at me worst. 'Twas me bleedin' pet's fault, I tell ye! Doesn't listen to a damn thing I say!

dialogue.name: ADVENTURER01454
dialogue.text: That an' the fact that none o' me so-called mates offered to help me. When I told 'em I was off to gut some hapalits, most of 'em gave me a confused “huh” or a “hmmm,” like I was talkin' out me arse. You, uh...don't agree though, right?

dialogue.name: ADVENTURER01454
dialogue.text: I know I look a right fool, but I'm just havin' a bad day, honest! Yer not goin' to “huh” or “hmmm” at me too, are ye!?

dialogue.name: ADVENTURER01454
dialogue.text: Er...what's that yer doin' there, mate? No offense, like, but...ye've lost me.

dialogue.name: ADVENTURER01454
dialogue.text: Gods, no! Not you too! That's the final bleedin' straw, that is!

dialogue.name: ADVENTURER01454
dialogue.text:
<sniffle> I was hopin' you of all people would understand... I mean, it ain't adventurin' if ye don't take a few risks, right...?
...Alright, maybe I am a bit out o' me depth here. I'll be more careful, I promise!

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename, you have my thanks. That lass I sent you out to instruct trudged back into town looking properly chastised.

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: I thought a lesson from you might pierce that obstinate skull of hers. Nothing I said seemed to work. Truth be told, she seemed more inclined to listen to the rustling of my beard than anything which came out of my mouth...

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: Ahem. But now that you have demonstrated the skills she yet lacks, it will not be long before her addle-pated peers hear the tale.

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: They will soon realize that one does not become a hero in a day: it requires dedication and perseverance, and learning from each task you undertake. There are no shortcuts, eh, Forename?
